text: Pope Urban VII (; 4 August 1521 â€“ 27 September 1590), born Giovanni Battista Castagna, was an Italian priest of the Roman Catholic Church and the 229th Pope. He ruled for thirteen days in September 1590, "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-13. and died before his consecration, from malaria. This makes him the shortest reigning Pope in the history of the Catholic Church. ==Early life== Castagna was of Genoan origin, although born in Rome.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1843). "Urban VII," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 26, p. 45. ==Priest== Castagna was ordained priest March 30, 1553."Pope Urban VII," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-11-13. ==Bishop== Pope Julius III appointed him Archbishop of Rossano on March 1, 1553. ==Cardinal== In 1584, Pope Gregory XIII made Castagna Cardinal of San Marcello. == Pope== Cardinal Castagna was elected pope on 15 September 1590. He chose the name Urban, which in Latin signifies "kind".
